result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony R Silva-Stulo in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony R Silva-Stulo is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony R Silva-Stulo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony R Silva-Stulo in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony R Silva-Stulo appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Upon motion of the State, Court ordered case DISMISSED without prejudice.

Defendant Anthony R Silva-Stulo in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Nolan has discovery and would like time to review it.    Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 026606,
Payable Number: 993410,
Receipt Number: 22RP011089,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with B.D.H. and J.C.P.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

04:30 PM Defendant Anthony R Silva-Stulo in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Anthony R Silva-Stulo in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony R Silva-Stulo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
